Open World Game Prototype
Project Overview
Game making was one of my top priorities since childhood. During my first year of college I finally started developing an Open-World game prototype.
Deciding Game Engine was a challenge. I went with Unreal because of its visual scripting feature. It took me a few days to understand the engine to work with it. Within 3 weeks I was able to make a simple game with a story and 4 mazes. The player had to find a treasure in the maze. After knowing the neccessery features, I started making the prototype and was testing my game regularly. Game's FPS was a problem, because your code have to be very optimised so that it can run on maximum PCs smoothly. Optimization was a serious priority for us. After making the game, a friend made a short youtube video to showcase the project, and uploaded the game on drive to make it available for friends to download. There was plan to publish the prototype on Epic Games Store as a template for begineers to understand fundamentals and linking of different systems. But this idea was later scrapped as it had become too complex for begineers to get grasp on.

Time of Work
It took approximately six months to complete the enite prototype.
Game making is really an time consuming and laborious work as it requires using and integrating a variety of softwares and files together to make it all work. Code Optimization and 3D model accumulation was the most time consuming work.

Resources Used and Skills Learnt
I mainly used youtube and Unreal official documantation for reference.
For ingame models I used mainly Blender and various 3-D modelling websites on the internet like Sketchfab, Free3D etc. I also used CC3 and Adobe Mixamo for making charecters. I also used free example projects on Unreal marketplace as reference for a few in-game mechanics.
